meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or occurring on the surface
meanings.sent1: The archaeologists found ancient artifacts in the surficial layer of the soil.
meanings.sent2: The surficial appearance of the painting was deceiving; underneath lay a masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: The surficial scratches on the car made it look like a giant cat had used it as a scratching post.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a surficial mask, hiding the turmoil within.
meanings.sent5: The surficial layer of snow sparkled in the sunlight, creating a winter wonderland.

meanings.sent1: His interest in the subject was only surficial; he didn't delve deeper into it.
meanings.sent2: The conversation remained at a surficial level, never touching on deeper topics.
meanings.sent3: The surficial understanding of the game led to many mistakes during play.
meanings.sent4: Her apology seemed surficial, lacking true remorse.
meanings.sent5: The surficial charm of the town faded once you got to know its residents.
